purpleculture_pinyin:
kuàng
to neglect; to skip (class or work); to waste (time); vast; loose-fitting
пренебрегать; пропускать (учебу или работу); Тратить время); огромный; свободный
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 旷)
Ideographic: A wide 廣 plain under the sun 日; 廣 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
曠野 [ kuàng yě ]: wilderness
曠日持久 [ kuàng rì chí jiǔ ]: protracted (idiom); long and drawn-out
曠工 [ kuàng gōng ]: to skip work; absence without leave

heisig_chinese_memo: Sun up to sun down, the internet becomes more expansive every second of everyday with new websites popping up all the time.
Ru_trainchinese:
kuàng: (графема) свободный от печали; ясный; просторный, обширный
kuàng: (прил) свободный, неплотно прилегающий (о деталях, одежде и т.д.)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the sun (日) shines on the broad (廣) wide open space
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The sun and the cave are  both expansive objects which grow larger over time.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " day " to " broad " sound, the original meaning is clear, clear and bright. "Shuowen": "Ming Ye. From the day to the sound." "The Book of the Later Han·Dou Rong Biography": "Loyal ministers have sore noses, but righteous men are forgiving." Li Xian quoted "Shuowen": " Kuang, Ming Ye."

" Kuang " can mean empty and open. "Lao Tzu": "It is as open as a valley, and it is as muddy as it is muddy."

" Kuang " also means waste. "Shu‧ Gao Tao Mo": "There is no general official, but the heavenly worker will replace it." Cai Chen's collection: "Kuang, abolish it. You can't use non-talent, and make the general abandon the official position."

" Kuang " also indicates a vacancy. "Mencius·Li Lou Shang": "Kuang An Zhai and Fu Ju, abandon the right road and Fu You, sorrow!"

" Kuang " also means lack. "Mandarin ‧ Chu Yuxia": "There are many people who are open, and I get rich. It is hard work and self-proclaimed, and there is no day for death." Wei Zhao's note: "Openness, but empty."

" Kuang " also means to stay away and alienate. "Liu Shichunqiu·Long Jian": "It is against my righteousness and courtesy to violate my courtesy, and to be uneasy with everything, and to be open and not to be content."

" Kuang " also means long and long. "Selected Works‧Lu Ji "Presenting a Wife for Gu Yanxian" Poem No. 2": "Shadows and shadows participate in the business, but the sound is not good." Li Shan quoted "Guang Ya": "Long, long time."
humanum_short_description_en: From " day " to " guang ", the original meaning is clear, clear and bright.
humanum_full_description:
從「日」，「廣」聲，本義為明白、明朗、明亮。《說文》：「明也。从日，廣聲。」《後漢書‧竇融傳》：「忠臣則酸鼻流涕，義士則曠若發矇。」李賢注引《說文》：「曠，明也。」

　　「曠」可表示空曠、開闊。《老子》：「曠兮其若谷，混兮其若濁。」

　　「曠」也表示荒廢。《書‧皋陶謨》：「無曠庶官，天工人其代之。」蔡沈集傳：「曠，廢也。言不可用非才，而使庶官曠廢厥職也。」

　　「曠」還表示空缺。《孟子‧離婁上》：「曠安宅而弗居，舍正路而弗由，哀哉！」

　　「曠」亦表示匱乏。《國語‧楚語下》：「民多曠也，而我取富也，是勤民以自封，死無日矣。」韋昭注：「曠，猶空也。」

　　「曠」也指遠離、疏遠。《呂氏春秋‧長見》：「莧譆數犯我以義，違我以禮，與處則不安，曠之而不穀得焉。」

　　「曠」亦指長久、久遠。《文選‧陸機〈為顧彥先贈婦〉詩之二》：「形影參商乖，音息曠不達。」李善注引《廣雅》：「曠，久也。」
humanum_short_description: 從「日」，「廣」聲，本義為明白、明朗、明亮。

Chinese: Sun up to sun down, the internet becomes more expansive every second of everyday with new websites popping up all the time.
Meaning: expansive
Hanzi: 旷
Story: The sun and the cave are both expansive objects which grow larger over time.
Kind: traditional

從「 日 」，「 廣 」聲，本義為明白、明朗、明亮。《說文》：「明也。从日，廣聲。」《後漢書‧竇融傳》：「忠臣則酸鼻流涕，義士則曠若發矇。」李賢注引《說文》：「曠，明也。」 「 曠 」可表示空曠、開闊。《老子》：「曠兮其若谷，混兮其若濁。」 「 曠 」也表示荒廢。《書‧皋陶謨》：「無曠庶官，天工人其代之。」蔡沈集傳：「曠，廢也。言不可用非才，而使庶官曠廢厥職也。」 「 曠 」還表示空缺。《孟子‧離婁上》：「曠安宅而弗居，舍正路而弗由，哀哉！」 「 曠 」亦表示匱乏。《國語‧楚語下》：「民多曠也，而我取富也，是勤民以自封，死無日矣。」韋昭注：「曠，猶空也。」 「 曠 」也指遠離、疏遠。《呂氏春秋‧長見》：「莧譆數犯我以義，違我以禮，與處則不安，曠之而不穀得焉。」 「 曠 」亦指長久、久遠。《文選‧陸機〈為顧彥先贈婦〉詩之二》：「形影參商乖，音息曠不達。」李善注引《廣雅》：「曠，久也。」
From " day" to " broad" sound, the original meaning is clear, clear and bright. "Shuowen": "Ming Ye. From the day to the sound." "The Book of the Later Han·Dou Rong Biography": "Loyal ministers have sore noses, but righteous men are forgiving." Li Xian quoted "Shuowen": " Kuang, Ming Ye." " Kuang" can mean empty and open. "Lao Tzu": "It is as open as a valley, and it is as muddy as it is muddy." " Kuang" also means waste. "Shu‧ Gao Tao Mo": "There is no general official, but the heavenly worker will replace it." Cai Chen's collection: "Kuang, abolish it. You can't use non-talent, and make the general abandon the official position." " Kuang" also indicates a vacancy. "Mencius·Li Lou Shang": "Kuang An Zhai and Fu Ju, abandon the right road and Fu You, sorrow!" " Kuang" also means lack. "Mandarin ‧ Chu Yuxia": "There are many people who are open, and I get rich. It is hard work and self-proclaimed, and there is no day for death." Wei Zhao's note: "Openness, but empty." " Kuang" also means to stay away and alienate. "Liu Shichunqiu·Long Jian": "It is against my righteousness and courtesy to violate my courtesy, and to be uneasy with everything, and to be open and not to be content." " Kuang" also means long and long. "Selected Works‧Lu Ji "Presenting a Wife for Gu Yanxian" Poem No. 2": "Shadows and shadows participate in the business, but the sound is not good." Li Shan quoted "Guang Ya": "Long, long time."

曠字的基本解释

曠
kuàng
见“旷”。

曠字的汉语字典释义

[①]［kuàng］
［《廣韻》苦謗切，去宕，溪。］
“懬1”的今字。亦作“爌3”。“旷1”的繁体字。
(1)明白；明朗；明亮。
(2)空旷；开阔。
(3)指广大，宽广。
(4)荒废。
(5)指失职。
(6)徒然，徒劳。
(7)空缺。
(8)匮乏。
(9)指使穷匮。
(10)遥远。
(11)远离；疏远。
(12)长久，久远。
(13)豁达。
(14)荒凉，荒芜。
(15)指无妻的成年男子。亦指无夫的成年女子。
(16)指成年男子无妇独居。
(17)姓。清有旷敏本。见清李桓《国朝耆献类徵初编》卷一二六。

曠字的康熙字典解释

【辰集上】【日字部】　曠； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页501第24
〔古文〕?【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?苦謗切，音壙。【說文】明也。【後漢·竇融傳】則曠若發曚。【註】曠，明也。　又【書·臯陶謨】無曠庶官。【傳】曠，空也。【前漢·賈山傳】曠日十年。【註】師古曰：曠，空也，廢也。【劉楨·贈五官中郞將詩】彌曠十餘旬。【註】《倉頡篇》曰：曠，疎曠也。　又【博雅】曠，遠也。曠曠，大也。【篇海】久也，豁也。【廣韻】又姓。

曠字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
曠字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words

kuàng
See "Kuang".
Open
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［kuàng］
["Guangyun" bitterly slander, go to Dang, Xi. ]
The present word for "懬1". Also known as "爌3". The traditional characters of "張1".
(1) Understand; bright; bright.
(2) Open; open.
(3) Means vast and broad.
(4) Wasted.
(5) Refers to negligence of duty.
(6) In vain, in vain.
(7) Vacancies.
(8) Lack.
(9) Instruct the poor.
(10) Far away.
(11) Stay away; alienate.
(12) Long, long.
(13) Open-minded.
(14) Desolate, barren.
(15) Refers to an adult man without a wife. Also refers to an adult woman without a husband.
(16) Refers to adult men living alone without women.
(17) Last name. There is a clear mind. See Li Huan in the Qing Dynasty, "The First Compilation of Guochao Fei Xian Lei", Volume 126.
Open
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chen Ji 1] [Japanese Character Department] 　kuang; Kangxi strokes: 19; page number: page 501 24
[Ancient text]? [Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun]? Hard to slander, sound. [Said Wen] Ming Ye. 【The Story of Later Han·Dou Rong】It is open and unrefined. [Note] Kuang, Ming Ye.　[Book·Gao Tao Mo] Wu Kuang general. 【Biography】Kuang, empty. [Previous Han·Jia Shan Biography] After ten years of work. [Note] Shi Gu said: open, empty, waste. [Liu Zhen·Poems of General Yan in the Five Senses] Mi Kuang more than ten days. [Note] "Cangjie Pian" says: Kuang, Jiu Kuang also.　[Bo Ya] Kuang, far away. Kuang Kuang, Da Ye. 【Pianhai】For a long time, you will be free. [Guang Yun] Another surname.
